basics.name: Shreyash Thorat
basics.label: Mechanical & Robotics Engineer
basics.summary: Graduate student in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Southern California with strong foundations in robotics, autonomous systems, and AI/ML. Experienced in design, modeling, simulation, and system integration with a proven record of leading projects and contributing to international Formula Student competitions.

work.name: GreenDzine Technologies Pvt Ltd
work.summary: I contributed to the development of electric intralogistic warehouse vehicles by designing and prototyping mechanical components, overseeing manufacturing processes, and ensuring quality through assembly and testing. I also supported streamlining the production pipeline to improve efficiency for large-scale warehouse operations (up to 100,000 sq. ft).

volunteer.summary: Led the suspension and steering subsystem for a Formula Student electric prototype, contributing to international competitions. Worked on vehicle dynamics, design, and optimization processes to improve overall performance. Also Led the Cost and Manufacturing event in Formula Student, managing cost analysis, process planning, and documentation to optimize design-for-manufacture decisions

education.institution: University of Southern California, Viterbi School of Engineering

awards.title: 2nd Position at Cost and Manufacturing Event
awards.summary: Recognized for cost optimization and manufacturing excellence.

awards.title: 2nd Overall in Electric Category
awards.summary: Secured overall 2nd position in the Electric category at Formula Bharat(India).

awards.title: 4th Position in Cost and Manufacturing Event
awards.summary: Achieved 4th place in cost and manufacturing event among international teams.

publications.name: Design and Development of a Model Rocket with Recovery System and Thrust Vectoring for Enhanced Performance and Stability
publications.summary: Authored research paper focused on developing a thrust-vectoring model rocket with an integrated recovery system for enhanced stability and performance.

projects.name: Model Rocket with Recovery System and Thrust Vectoring
projects.summary: Designed and developed a model rocket with an integrated recovery system and thrust vectoring for enhanced performance and stability.

projects.name: Classification of Pressure Vessels using ANN
projects.summary: Built a dataset of vessel images and implemented CNN-based classification to distinguish between horizontal, vertical, and spherical vessels for inspection tasks

projects.name: Real-Time Surveillance Quadcopter for Flood Rescue
projects.summary: Led a team project to design and build a quadcopter for real-time aerial surveillance in flood rescue operationss.

projects.name: Automatic Trash Bin using Arduino
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a low-cost automatic trash bin using Arduino microcontroller and sensors for automated lid operation.
